column4: I'm commanding sudo kill -9 PID but it won't kill my process ... is there something else i need to do?
Yeah Out_Cold the specific PID is 9805, just didn't include that in my message lol
so my command was sudo kill -9 9805 but the process won't die
it's a firefox process
yeah Out_Cold that's what I used to to find the PID and verify that it's still running after I did "kill -9 9805"
yeah I tried that too FiReSTaRT used sudo killall firefox
still won't die :|
what's the state of the process as per 'ps aux' ?
state D indicate "Uninterruptible sleep (usually IO)" -- meaning that the process is waiting for some suspended IO to complete, things like a hung disk access, network, etc
interesting unop ... is there anything i cna do to kill the process? I don't know why it's still running i don't have a window open i just see the process running when i run ps aux
damn I was hoping that wouldn't be my only option but it seems it is :(
such a pain to launch all my programs again lol
Out_Cold - you cannot kill a process in state D -- you'll have to wait it out or fix the IO problem
what was firefox doing before you attempted to kill it?

not sure I had just closed firefox before and when I came back to my comp i tried to open it again and got the message that it was still running so I used ps aux | grep firefox and here i am trying to kill it heh
i guess it just never properly closed the window?
and did you do a kill -9 right off the bat?
no tried killall firefox first
it was in state D from the beginning though
can you open another instance of firefox?
only if I launch with the profile manager and use a dif profile
strange, guess a reboot is imminent then - it's probably the only thing you can do
